intro: Viguiera revoluta, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense, gray-green foliage. The plant produces showy, purple-pink flower heads in late summer to early fall, which are clustered in spherical shapes. Viguiera revoluta is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value and ecological benefits make it a desirable plant for native gardens.
